context: a malicious  Word  or  RTF  document  was  sent  to specific  employees

metadata.description: In each campaign, a malicious Word or RTF document was sent to specific employees. This is a form of spearphishing where the attacker targets specific individuals with malicious attachments to gain initial access.

context: This from social isaugmentedwitha engineeringscam personalphonecall theattacker,

metadata.description: This technique involves using social engineering over a phone call to persuade the victim to open a malicious email attachment. The attacker's follow-up call to confirm the document was opened adds another layer of social engineering to ensure the malicious payload is executed.

context: ThemeterpreterDLL ismade operational  via  reflective  DLL  injection,  which copies  the  meterpreter  DLL  into  the  memory space  of  a  chosen  victim  process  (such  as explorer.exe) and runs it as a thread.

metadata.description: dversaries inject code into the address space of another process to execute their payload. Reflective DLL injection is a method of process injection where a DLL is loaded into the address space of a process without the use of traditional Windows APIs.

context: ThemeterpreterDLL ismade operational  via  reflective  DLL  injection,  which copies  the  meterpreter  DLL  into  the  memory space  of  a  chosen  victim  process  (such  as explorer.exe) and runs it as a thread.

context: A PowerShell script created by the infected email attachment

metadata.description: This technique involves using PowerShell to execute commands and scripts. The described behavior of using a PowerShell script to handle a base64-encoded payload is a common use case of PowerShell for malicious activities.

context: contains a base64-encoded block of text that is decoded,

metadata.description: This technique includes various methods of obfuscating files or data to avoid detection. Base64 encoding is a common method of obfuscation used to hide the contents of a payload.

context: written into memory as a thread, and executed.

metadata.description: This technique involves injecting code into the memory space of another process. The action of writing the decoded payload into memory and executing it as a thread aligns with process injection techniques.
